trans-unit.source: Specifies how many times an instance of a template can be created.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstance> enumeration specifies values indicating the number of times an instance of a template can be created.
The ttribute class uses values from the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateInstanceAttribute> enumeration.
In particular, the ttribute.Single and ttribute.Multiple fields specify single and multiple instances of a template, respectively.
A single instance of a template allows you to reference controls that are contained within the template.

Examples of controls that use the Single value in property metadata include the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogZone.ZoneTemplate%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogZone> control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZone.ZoneTemplate%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZone> control, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZone.ZoneTemplate%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZone>.
A template that is instantiated multiple times.
A template that is instantiated only one time.
